ipInfos.Title: IP Infos
ipInfos.Notes: IP data will be checked from 6 sources. If there is only 1 IP stack currently, sources without data will show as empty.
ipInfos.IPv4Error: Fetch Failed or No IPv4 Address
ipInfos.IPv6Error: Fetch Failed or No IPv6 Address

connectivity.Title: Network Connectivity
connectivity.Note: Testing is done by loading small images from corresponding websites. Delay values are for reference only and will be smaller in reality.

webrtc.Title: WebRTC Test
webrtc.Note: WebRTC often establishes connections directly via UDP. If the test returns your real IP, it means your proxy settings do not cover these connections.

dnsleaktest.Name: Test
dnsleaktest.Title: DNS Leak Test
dnsleaktest.Note: A DNS leak means that when you are connected to a VPN/proxy, your domain name resolutions are still done through your local ISP, thus posing a risk of DNS leaks.
dnsleaktest.Note2: The method to test for DNS leaks involves accessing a newly generated domain name to detect which regional DNS exit you are resolving through. If the endpoint region returned matches your local service provider's region, there is a risk of DNS leakage. In this case, you may need to modify your VPN/proxy settings.

speedtest.Title: Speed Test
speedtest.Note: Speed test will be done via Cloudflare's edge network, which may take a long time. If your network is located in mainland China, the data may be biased. The speed test results are for reference only, the actual speed will be faster.
speedtest.score: Based on the speed test, got the following quality scores:
speedtest.resultNote: . The score is for reference only.

pingtest.Title: Global Latency Test
pingtest.Note: Ping test is a network tool used to measure the round-trip time of data packets from your device to specific targets (in this case, our servers located in different continents and regions). It is a key metric for evaluating network performance.
pingtest.Note2: In this process, IPCheck.ing sends small packets of data from servers around the world to your IP address and measures the time it takes for these packets to travel from the server to your device and back. Through these Ping tests from different geographical locations, you can gain a comprehensive view of the speed and stability of your device's connection to the global network.
pingtest.Note3: Currently only IPv4 addresses are supported. Please select your IP address for testing.
pingtest.Error: Test failed, it looks like your IP is not allowed to perform Ping test.

mtrtest.Title: MTR Test
mtrtest.Note: The MTR (My Traceroute) test performs detailed route tracing of your IP address from servers located in different continents and regions around the world. MTR combines the functionality of traditional traceroute and ping commands to diagnose the quality and performance of network connections in real-time.
mtrtest.Note2: This process covers the complete path from various geographical locations to your network environment, providing information on latency and packet loss for each hop. Whether it's congestion in the routing path, latency issues at a specific node, or packet loss during transmission, the MTR test provides critical diagnostic information.
mtrtest.Note3: Currently only IPv4 addresses are supported. Please select your IP address for testing.
mtrtest.Error: Test failed, it looks like your IP is not allowed to perform MTR test.

ipcheck.Title: IP Check
ipcheck.Error: Please enter a valid IPv4 or IPv6 address.

alert.OhNo_Message: Connectivity test failed, some websites are not accessible.
alert.Congrats_Message: All connectivity tests passed, you can access all websites.
alert.maskedInfoMessage_1: IP information has been masked, please be careful when taking screenshots.
alert.maskedInfoMessage: All information has been masked, you can now safely take screenshots.
alert.unmaskedInfoMessage: Information has been unmasked, please be careful when taking screenshots.

shortcutKeys.HelpNote: People who use shortcuts are really awesome!

page.title: IPCheck.ing - Check My IP Address and Geolocation - Check WebRTC Connection IP - DNS Leak Test - Speed Test - Jason Ng Open Source
page.description: A better IP Toolbox. Easy to check what's your IPs, IP informations, check for DNS leaks, examine WebRTC connections, and test website availability
page.keywords: MyIP,IP Tool,My IP,IP check,IP lookup,DNS leak test,WebRTC test,Speed test
page.footerName: Creators: Jason Ng, Seven Yu & ChatGPT

addBingMapKey.Title: Add Bing Map API Key
addBingMapKey.Note: After adding, the map can be displayed in the IP information. The API Key will only be saved in the current browser for the next use, and will not be uploaded to the server.
addBingMapKey.Placeholder: Please enter Bing Map API Key
addBingMapKey.Error: Please enter a valid Bing Map API Key.

about.Title: About
about.product1: IPCheck.ing is a free IP toolbox that helps you check your IP information, test website availability, examine DNS exit information, perform speed tests, global latency tests, MTR tests, and more.
about.product2: This is an open-source project, and you can view the source code by clicking on the GitHub icon at the bottom of the page.
about.product3: Initially, this was a personal project for me to learn Vue.js and how to write code using ChatGPT. Over time, it gained more stars on GitHub, so I did a lot of refactoring and added many useful features. I hope you will enjoy it.
about.me1: My name is Jason Ng, also known as Ach√°n online. I'm not a professional programmer, but I love coding, open-source, and sharing.
about.me2: Most of the time, I work as a product manager, a blogger, a motorcyle rider and a geek.
about.me3: You can find a more detailed introduction about me in the following link:
about.contact: If you have any questions or suggestions, please contact me via email: jason[AT]kenengba.com.

content.change: Display IP information before and after proxy
Refactored the entire project using Vue2
Support displaying Bing maps in the frontend
Support PWA, can be installed on mobile and desktop
Support retrieving IP geolocation information from multiple sources
Refactored the entire project using Vite + Vue3
Multiple performance and user experience optimizations
